required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Invasive Hemodynamic Response to Transcatheter Edge-to-Edge Mitral Valve Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Invasive Hemodynamic Response to Transcatheter Edge-to-Edge Mitral Valve Repair

brief_summary.textblock: Studying the effects of Trans-catheter Mitral Valve Repair (TMVr) on the hemodynamics and biomarkers in patients with severe mitral valve regurgitation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, approximately 10 mins after valve repair
primary_outcome.description: Change in stroke volume index 10 minutes post repair to baseline stroke volume index measurement (L/m^2)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, approximately 10 mins after valve repair
primary_outcome.description: Change in cardiac index 10 minutes post repair to baseline cardiac index measurement (L/min/m^2)

arm_group.description: Subjects with severe, symptomatic primary mitral regurgitation (MR) scheduled to undergo a transcatheter mitral valve repair (TMVr) as standard of care will have intra-op baseline and post repair blood draws. Pre-procedure and post-procedure transthoracic echocardiograms (TTE) will assess the hemodynamic implications of the repair.

study_pop.textblock: Patients receiving a standard of care mitraclip for mitral regurgitation symptom alleviation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults (age â‰¥ 40 years) with severe, symptomatic primary mitral regurgitation identified by Doppler transthoracic echocardiogram
- Heart team (cardiologist and cardiac surgeon) agree that patient would be eligible for TMVR with MitraClip
- TMVR procedure will be performed in the cardiac catheterization laboratory for hemodynamic data recording
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant or believe they could be pregnant
